verses.kjv: Now when he had ended all his sayings in the audience of the people, he entered into Capernaum.
verses.ct: After Jesus had finished saying all of this to the crowd, he went into Capernaum.

verses.kjv: And a certain centurion’s servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.
verses.ct: A Roman centurion there had a servant he valued highly, who was sick and close to death.

verses.kjv: And when he heard of Jesus, he sent unto him the elders of the Jews, beseeching him that he would come and heal his servant.
verses.ct: When the centurion heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him, asking him to come and heal his servant.

verses.kjv: And when they came to Jesus, they besought him instantly, saying, That he was worthy for whom he should do this:
verses.ct: They came to Jesus and pleaded urgently with him, saying, "This man deserves your help.

verses.kjv: For he loveth our nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.
verses.ct: He loves our people, and he even built our synagogue for us."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus went with them. And when he was now not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying unto him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof:
verses.ct: So Jesus went with them. But when he was getting close to the house, the centurion sent some friends with a message: "Lord, don't go to any trouble for me. I'm not worthy enough to have you come into my home.

verses.kjv: Wherefore neither thought I myself worthy to come unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.
verses.ct: That's why I didn't even consider myself worthy to come to you in person. Just give the command, and my servant will be healed.

verses.kjv: For I also am a man set under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say unto one, Go, and he goeth; and to another, Come, and he cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.
verses.ct: I understand how authority works — I'm a man under authority myself, with soldiers under me. I tell one, 'Go,' and he goes. I tell another, 'Come,' and he comes. I tell my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."

verses.kjv: When Jesus heard these things, he marvelled at him, and turned him about, and said unto the people that followed him, I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.
verses.ct: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed by the man. He turned to the crowd following him and said, "I'm telling you, I haven't found faith this strong anywhere in Israel."

verses.kjv: And they that were sent, returning to the house, found the servant whole that had been sick.
verses.ct: When the messengers returned to the house, they found the servant completely well again.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city called Nain; and many of his disciples went with him, and much people.
verses.ct: The next day, Jesus traveled to a town called Nain, accompanied by many of his disciples and a large crowd.

verses.kjv: Now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was a dead man carried out, the only son of his mother, and she was a widow: and much people of the city was with her.
verses.ct: As he approached the town gate, a funeral procession was coming out. The dead man was the only son of a widow, and a large crowd from the town was with her.

verses.kjv: And when the Lord saw her, he had compassion on her, and said unto her, Weep not.
verses.ct: When the Lord saw her, his heart went out to her, and he said, "Don't cry."

verses.kjv: And he came and touched the bier: and they that bare him stood still. And he said, Young man, I say unto thee, Arise.
verses.ct: Then he walked up and touched the stretcher carrying the body, and the men carrying it stopped. He said, "Young man, I'm telling you — get up."

verses.kjv: And he that was dead sat up, and began to speak. And he delivered him to his mother.
verses.ct: The dead man sat up and started talking. Then Jesus gave him back to his mother.

verses.kjv: And there came a fear on all: and they glorified God, saying, That a great prophet is risen up among us; and, That God hath visited his people.
verses.ct: Everyone was filled with awe, and they praised God, saying, "A great prophet has appeared among us!" and "God has come to help his people!"

verses.kjv: And this rumour of him went forth throughout all Judaea, and throughout all the region round about.
verses.ct: This news about Jesus spread throughout all of Judea and the entire surrounding region.

verses.kjv: And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.
verses.ct: John's disciples reported all of these events to him.

verses.kjv: And John calling unto him two of his disciples sent them to Jesus, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
verses.ct: So John called 2 of his disciples and sent them to the Lord to ask, "Are you the one who was promised to come, or should we be waiting for someone else?"

verses.kjv: When the men were come unto him, they said, John Baptist hath sent us unto thee, saying, Art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
verses.ct: When the men reached Jesus, they said, "John the Baptist sent us to ask you: Are you the one who was promised to come, or should we be waiting for someone else?"

verses.kjv: And in that same hour he cured many of their infirmities and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto many that were blind he gave sight.
verses.ct: Right at that time, Jesus was healing many people of diseases, afflictions, and evil spirits, and he was restoring sight to many who were blind.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus answering said unto them, Go your way, and tell John what things ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to the poor the gospel is preached.
verses.ct: Then Jesus answered them, "Go back and report to John what you've seen and heard: blind people are seeing, paralyzed people are walking, those with leprosy are being healed, deaf people are hearing, dead people are being raised to life, and the good news is being announced to the poor.

verses.kjv: And blessed is he, whosoever shall not be offended in me.
verses.ct: And how fortunate is the person who doesn't lose faith because of me."

verses.kjv: And when the messengers of John were departed, he began to speak unto the people concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness for to see? A reed shaken with the wind?
verses.ct: After John's messengers left, Jesus began speaking to the crowd about John: "What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A blade of grass swaying in the wind?

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? Behold, they which are gorgeously apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings’ courts.
verses.ct: Then what did you go out to see? A man dressed in expensive clothing? Look, people who wear fine clothes and live in luxury are found in royal palaces.

verses.kjv: But what went ye out for to see? A prophet? Yea, I say unto you, and much more than a prophet.
verses.ct: So what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes — and I'm telling you, he's far more than a prophet.

verses.kjv: This is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
verses.ct: He is the one the Scriptures talk about: 'Look, I am sending my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you.'

verses.kjv: For I say unto you, Among those that are born of women there is not a greater prophet than John the Baptist: but he that is least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.
verses.ct: I'm telling you, among all people ever born, there is no one greater than John the Baptist. Yet even the least important person in the kingdom of God is greater than he is."

verses.kjv: And all the people that heard him, and the publicans, justified God, being baptized with the baptism of John.
verses.ct: All the common people who heard this, including the tax collectors, acknowledged that God's way was right, since they had been baptized by John.

verses.kjv: But the Pharisees and lawyers rejected the counsel of God against themselves, being not baptized of him.
verses.ct: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law rejected God's purpose for them, because they had refused to be baptized by John.

verses.kjv: And the Lord said, Whereunto then shall I liken the men of this generation? and to what are they like?
verses.ct: Then the Lord said, "So what can I compare the people of this generation to? What are they like?

verses.kjv: They are like unto children sitting in the marketplace, and calling one to another, and saying, We have piped unto you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept.
verses.ct: They're like children sitting in the marketplace calling out to each other: 'We played music for you, but you wouldn't dance! We sang sad songs, but you wouldn't cry!'

verses.kjv: For John the Baptist came neither eating bread nor drinking wine; and ye say, He hath a devil.
verses.ct: John the Baptist came living an austere life — not eating bread or drinking wine — and you say, 'He has a demon.'

verses.kjv: The Son of man is come eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a gluttonous man, and a winebibber, a friend of publicans and sinners!
verses.ct: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and you say, 'Look at this man — a glutton and a drunk, hanging around with tax collectors and sinners!'

verses.kjv: But wisdom is justified of all her children.
verses.ct: But wisdom proves itself right through all those who follow it."

verses.kjv: And one of the Pharisees desired him that he would eat with him. And he went into the Pharisee’s house, and sat down to meat.
verses.ct: One of the Pharisees invited Jesus to have dinner with him. So Jesus went to the Pharisee's house and reclined at the table.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a woman in the city, which was a sinner, when she knew that Jesus sat at meat in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster box of ointment,
verses.ct: A woman from that town who had lived a sinful life found out that Jesus was eating at the Pharisee's house. She brought an alabaster jar of perfumed oil

verses.kjv: And stood at his feet behind him weeping, and began to wash his feet with tears, and did wipe them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed them with the ointment.
verses.ct: and stood behind him at his feet, crying. Her tears began falling on his feet, and she wiped them with her hair, kissed his feet, and poured the perfumed oil on them.

verses.kjv: Now when the Pharisee which had bidden him saw it, he spake within himself, saying, This man, if he were a prophet, would have known who and what manner of woman this is that toucheth him: for she is a sinner.
verses.ct: When the Pharisee who had invited Jesus saw this, he thought to himself, "If this man were really a prophet, he would know what kind of woman is touching him — she's a sinner."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto him, Simon, I have somewhat to say unto thee. And he saith, Master, say on.
verses.ct: Jesus spoke up and said, "Simon, I have something to tell you." Simon replied, "Go ahead, Teacher."

verses.kjv: There was a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed five hundred pence, and the other fifty.
verses.ct: "A moneylender had 2 people who owed him money. One owed 500 silver coins, and the other owed 50.

verses.kjv: And when they had nothing to pay, he frankly forgave them both. Tell me therefore, which of them will love him most?
verses.ct: Neither of them could pay him back, so he generously canceled both debts. Now tell me — which of them will love him more?"

verses.kjv: Simon answered and said, I suppose that he, to whom he forgave most. And he said unto him, Thou hast rightly judged.
verses.ct: Simon answered, "I would guess the one who had the larger debt canceled." Jesus told him, "You've judged correctly."

verses.kjv: And he turned to the woman, and said unto Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: but she hath washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with the hairs of her head.
verses.ct: Then he turned toward the woman and said to Simon, "Do you see this woman? When I came into your house, you didn't give me water for my feet. But she has washed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.

verses.kjv: Thou gavest me no kiss: but this woman since the time I came in hath not ceased to kiss my feet.
verses.ct: You didn't greet me with a kiss. But from the moment I arrived, she hasn't stopped kissing my feet.

verses.kjv: My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but this woman hath anointed my feet with ointment.
verses.ct: You didn't put oil on my head. But she has poured perfumed oil on my feet.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I say unto thee, Her sins, which are many, are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven, the same loveth little.
verses.ct: That is why I'm telling you — her many sins have been forgiven, and that's why she has shown such great love. But whoever has been forgiven only a little loves only a little."

verses.kjv: And he said unto her, Thy sins are forgiven.
verses.ct: Then he said to her, "Your sins are forgiven."

verses.kjv: And they that sat at meat with him began to say within themselves, Who is this that forgiveth sins also?
verses.ct: The other guests at the table started thinking to themselves, "Who is this man who even forgives sins?"

verses.kjv: And he said to the woman, Thy faith hath saved thee; go in peace.
verses.ct: But Jesus said to the woman, "Your faith has saved you. Go in peace."
